snippet: The gap grew more than expected in December, and economic improvement lifted imports to their highest level in three and a half years.
abstract: Commerce Department reports trade deficit in December 2011 rose to $48.8 billion; Thomson Reuters/University of Michigan index of consumer sentiment fell to 72.5 in February from 75.0 in January.
lead_paragraph: The gap grew more than expected in December, and economic improvement lifted imports to their highest level in three and a half years.
